feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a feature that automatically computes daily pay deductions for employees who take unpaid leave. It calculates daily pay by dividing the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The calculation accounts for public holidays by deducting them from the working days count. Once an unpaid leave request is approved, the system automatically generates a pay deduction reflected on the payroll table. The feature supports both calendar days and working days leave policies.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages to determine salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction amounts with greater control and alignment to company policies and labor law requirements.

To allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations, enabling control over which salary components are included and how daily wages are calculated for leave encashment purposes.
To calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis for employee payroll, enabling deductions to be set off against the employee's monthly pay.
Adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration.
Super Admins who configure leave policies and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access the Daily Wage Calculator by navigating to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure.
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave option selection.

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist for the employee; the leave policy (calendar days or working days) must be configured; employee salary information (basic + allowance) must be available in the system
Company's public holiday calendar must be set up to accurately exclude weekends and public holidays when using the working days calculation base.
User must have super admin role to access and configure the Daily Wage Calculator settings.
Access to Leave Settings and ability to add or modify leave policies as a Super Admin.
Super admin access to payroll settings; active payroll system with employee records

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary amount (basic salary plus allowance), number of working days in the month, number of public holidays in the month, approved unpaid leave days

Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and selection of salary components to factor into calculations (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).

Selection of salary components (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), selection of calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days), and configuration of eligible leave types for encashment.
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days) when configuring unpaid leave deduction in a leave policy.
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction associated with the unpaid leave request, calculated daily pay rate, deduction reflected on the payroll table
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
A customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations and determines which salary components and calculation methods apply to leave encashment.
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation settings that determine how daily deductions are applied to monthly employee pay.
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on selected calculation method; changes apply to all active (unpaid) payroll amounts

procedures.content: Receive unpaid leave request, approve the leave request, determine the applicable leave policy (calendar days or working days), calculate total working days in the month, subtract public holidays from working days, calculate daily pay by dividing salary by actual working days, generate automatic payroll deduction

Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select a calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose which salary components to include in the calculation.

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure. 2. Select salary components applicable to leave encashments (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances). 3. Choose a calculation method (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days). 4. Configure individual leave types for end-of-service calculations.

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select the Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days).

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and then save the new proration settings

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay is calculated using the formula: Salary Amount (Basic + Allowance) divided by Number of actual working days in the month. The leave policy determines whether calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days) are used. Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from the working days count to arrive at actual working days. The system automatically creates pay deductions upon approval of unpaid leave requests.

Calculation base options are limited to calendar days (all days in a month), working days (business days only, excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (company-defined basis). Most UAE and KSA companies set custom days to 30 to comply with local labor law requirements.

Salary component selection is limited to two options: Basic Only or Basic + Allowances. Calculation method selection is limited to three options: Calendar days, Working days, or Custom days. Leave encashment configuration applies specifically to end-of-service calculations.

Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated on a daily basis and set off against the employee's monthly pay. Multiple calculation method options are available (Basic Only, Basic + Allowances) and multiple day calculation types are available (Calendar days, Working days, Custom days).

Changes to salary proration affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist for one or multiple employees, Super admin must reject those transactions before saving new proration settings

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be carefully identified and subtracted from the working days when calculating daily pay. For example, if 2 public holidays fall in a month with 22 working days, the daily pay calculation must be based on 20 days, not 22 days.

Calendar days calculation varies by month length (e.g., 31 days in January, 28 days in February), and different calculation bases produce different daily wage rates, which impacts final salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction amounts.

Super admins can view which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten by the new Daily Wage Calculator configuration, allowing visibility into the impact of changes before they are applied.
Multiple options exist for daily rate calculation including Basic Only and Basic + Allowances, requiring careful selection based on organizational payroll policies.

When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions have been submitted for employees, Super admin must manually reject existing transactions before saving new salary proration configuration changes

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: Interacts with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions; depends on leave management system for unpaid leave request approval; requires integration with employee record systems for salary information; connected to leave policy configuration

The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with Payroll settings, public holiday calendar configuration, and leave management systems to calculate accurate daily wage rates for salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions.

The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with Payroll settings, End of Service calculations, and Leave Management system to customize leave encashment policies and affects how leave is valued in end-of-service settlements.
Interacts with the payroll system by calculating daily deductions that are applied to monthly employee pay; similar configuration approach to leave encashment.
Interacts with Payroll system, payroll table (active/unpaid amounts), and employee salary calculations for first salary and end-of-service settlement

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: The amount calculated by dividing an employee's total salary by the number of actual working days in a month, used to determine deductions for unpaid leave. Working days: The number of business days in a month, excluding weekends and public holidays. Calendar days: A fixed number of days (e.g., 30 days) used as the basis for leave calculations in certain leave policies. Public holidays: Days designated as official holidays that are excluded from working day calculations. Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without receiving salary for those days.

Calendar days: the number of days in a given month (e.g., 31 in January, 28 in February). Working days: only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays set up on the company's public holiday calendar. Custom days: a company-defined calculation base allowing flexibility to set the number of days according to company policies (commonly set to 30 in UAE and KSA to align with labor law).

Leave encashment: The conversion of accrued but unused leave into monetary compensation. End-of-service: The final settlement of employee benefits and compensation upon termination or separation. Daily Wage Calculator: A configuration tool for customizing leave encashment calculations.

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without compensation, subject to daily rate deduction calculations. Daily rate calculation: The method used to determine the daily deduction amount based on salary components (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day type (Calendar days, Working days, Custom days).

DWC (Daily Wage Calculator): System component for configuring salary proration. Salary proration: Proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: Methods for determining prorated salary—custom days, calendar days, or working days
